formulas.raw: Definition: 1 eV is the energy gained by an electron when it is accelerated through an electric potential difference of 1 volt. Since the elementary charge is exactly e = 1.602176634×10⁻¹⁹ C, and 1 V × 1 C = 1 J, we get: 1 eV = 1.602176634×10⁻¹⁹ J (exact) So, generally: J = eV × 1.602176634×10⁻¹⁹ eV = J ÷ 1.602176634×10⁻¹⁹
